body.p:
If you used to work with /2 Version 1.0 and want to continue using the translation material from this product, follow these steps:
Back up remote translation materialBefore you install Version 6.0 you must make backup copies from any Translation Memory databases and dictionaries that have been defined as remote under /2. You do this by exporting them within a folder (see ). This folder must have a reference to the Translation Memory or dictionary you want to back up. Store this folder in a save place. It is recommended to save one Translation Memory and one dictionary per folder. Note that only remote translation material must be backed up. You need not back up local translation material.
Install Version 6.0See for the installation procedure.
Restore backup copiesAfter you installed Version 6.0 you can restore the saved translation material by importing the folders that you exported previously from /2 Version 1.0. The same procedure applies for any archived /2 folders, Translation Memory databases (in EXP format), and dictionaries (in SGML format). All remote translation material from /2 Version 1.0 is then ready to be used in Version 6.0.
Note that before use you must organize not only the restored translation material but also your local Translation Memory databases and dictionaries (see and ). Keep in mind that this translation material is not automatically defined as shared in Version 6.0.
